results.title: [Maurie Fields and Val Jellay Home Movies: Reel 1]
results.brief_description:
This film is a snippet from a family holiday in Bangkok, Thailand.

Some of the footage is grainy and underexposed with some very unstable handheld sequences.

The film opens with a Bangkok street scene of a man holding a python wrapped around his arms and neck. We are then taken to the Grand Palace in the Phra Nakon district of Bangkok. The Grand Palace has been the official residence of the Kings of Siam (Thailand) since 1782. The King, his court, and his royal government were based on the grounds of the palace until 1925.

We see the grounds and buildings that comprise the palace, including Wat Phra Kaew (the Temple of the Emerald Buddha), Chakri Maha Prasat Hall, the Belfry and Hor Phra Monthian Dharma. We see the beautiful glazed tiles and gold leaf facade of Wat Phra Kaew (Temple of the Emerald Buddha). We see tourists taking photos and wandering around the site and there is scaffolding surrounding what could be Phra Siratana Chedi.

A very colorful Val Jellay, wearing a Kaftan style dress, poses on stairs leading to the entrance of the Temple of the Emerald Buddha. She entertains her son and the camera operator while she strikes various traditional Thai-style dance poses.

Originally shot on Super 8mm film.

results.title: The Lion king
results.creator_credit: Rob Minkoff, Roger Allers, Don Hahn and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: This beautifully animated and wonderfully scored feature film tells the story of the love between a proud lion ruler, Mufasa, and his son, Simba - a naive and curious cub who must find his place in the “circle of life”. Through the help of his friends, and his determination to meet the toughest challenges, Simba eventually takes his place as the rightful ruler of the Pride Lands. His search to meet his destiny puts him face to face in a struggle to the death with his evil uncle Scar and also leads him towards true love. Elton John and Tim Rice’s award winning songs, an excellent score by Hans Zimmer, and voice characterisations by Jeremy Irons, James Earl Jones, Rowan Atkinson, Robert Guillame, Moira Kelly and Matthew Broderick as Simba, make this an unforgettable experience.

constellations_other.name: The drama and nuance of silhouette
constellations_other.description: Ali Gumillya Baker uses silhouette to evocative effect in her work reimagining the colonial gaze. The lighting technique has long been employed by filmmakers for its ability to dramatically convey a wide variety of emotions in everything from film noir to animation and whimsy.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Rob Minkoff, Roger Allers, Don Hahn and Walt Disney Pictures

results.title: Young Einstein
results.creator_credit: Yahoo Serious, David Roach, Warwick Ross and Serious Productions
results.brief_description: A classic Aussie comedy based on the premise that Albert Einstein not only developed the theory of relativity but also invented rock `n’ roll.

constellations_other.name: Great southern land?
constellations_other.description: Australia is often mythologised in film and TV, but national myths must not only be embraced, but resisted.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Yahoo Serious, David Roach, Warwick Ross and Serious Productions
results.description: A comedy based on the premise that Albert Einstein not only developed the theory of relativity but also invented rock `n’ roll. Albert Einstein sails the world, falls in love with the world’s most intelligent and beautiful girl, Marie Curie, creates the first surfboard, invents the electric guitar and uses rock’n’roll to save the planet from atomic destruction. Virtually a one-man tour de force by Yahoo Serious and co-starring Odile le Clezio, John Howard, Peewee Wilson, Su Cruickshank.
description_for_label: A comedy based on the premise that Albert Einstein not only developed the theory of relativity but also invented rock `n’ roll. Albert Einstein sails the world, falls in love with the world’s most intelligent and beautiful girl, Marie Curie, creates the first surfboard, invents the electric guitar and uses rock’n’roll to save the planet from atomic destruction. Virtually a one-man tour de force by Yahoo Serious and co-starring Odile le Clezio, John Howard, Peewee Wilson, Su Cruickshank.

images.alt_text: The theatrical poster for Young Einsten, featuring a young man with crazy red hair surrounded by electricity

results.title: A.I. Artificial intelligence
results.creator_credit: Steven Spielberg, Bonnie Curtis, Kathleen Kennedy, NBCUniversal and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: A.I. is the story of David, a cyber boy, realistically designed and programmed to provide unconditional love to its owner. He enters the home of Monica and David, where Monica, after initial problems, embraces his presence… until their biological son returns.

constellations_other.name: 9.5mm Pathe-Baby and parents behaving badly
constellations_other.description: A look at the link between the Pathé-Baby system and animation, as well as the relationship between cinematic parents and their children.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Steven Spielberg, Bonnie Curtis, Kathleen Kennedy, NBCUniversal and Warner Bros Pictures
results.description: Intending “A.I.” as a collaboration between himself and Steven Spielberg, Stanley Kubrick created various treatments and hundreds of storyboards for the film - upon Kubrick’s death Spielberg inherited the project as director and co-producer. “A.I.” is the story of David, a cyber boy, realistically designed and programmed to provide unconditional love to its owner. David enters the home of Monica and David, where Monica, after initial problems, embraces his presence. Trouble brews however when Martin (the couple’s biological son, recovering from an illness) returns home and displaces David. David is turned out into the wilderness where he meets Gigolo Joe, a love robot on the run. Joe and David visit Rouge City, in search of the Blue Fairy (whom David is convinced will grant him mortality) and then to a Flesh Fair where the two witness a carnival of robot torture. “A.I.” is a fantastical quest that depicts a robot yearning to be real and hence loved, themes echoed in “Pinocchio” (a touchstone in the film) and “Blade runner.” A film with three quite distinct acts, “A.I.” is saturated with memorable images, set pieces and costumes, as well as some interesting concepts and ethical moral dilemmas but is compromised by its eagerness to provide David with a happy ending.
description_for_label: Intending “A.I.” as a collaboration between himself and Steven Spielberg, Stanley Kubrick created various treatments and hundreds of storyboards for the film - upon Kubrick’s death Spielberg inherited the project as director and co-producer. “A.I.” is the story of David, a cyber boy, realistically designed and programmed to provide unconditional love to its owner. David enters the home of Monica and David, where Monica, after initial problems, embraces his presence. Trouble brews however when Martin (the couple’s biological son, recovering from an illness) returns home and displaces David. David is turned out into the wilderness where he meets Gigolo Joe, a love robot on the run. results.title: Lethal Weapon
results.creator_credit: Richard Donner, Joel Silver and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Mel Gibson stars as Martin Riggs, a loner cop with a tragic past which drives him to act with reckless disregard for his own safety.

constellations_other.name: Nadia Tass
constellations_other.description: Comedic and cult classics take centre stage in Nadia Tass' career.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Donner, Joel Silver and Warner Bros Pictures
results.description: Mel Gibson stars as Martin Riggs, a loner cop with a tragic past which drives him to act with reckless disregard for his own safety. Danny Glover also stars as dependable family-man cop Roger Murtaugh, just turned 50 and facing retirement, just wants to live long enough to see that day. When he is teamed with Riggs the possibility that he will seems very unlikely. The main villain is The General (Mitchell Ryan), a drug dealer responsible for the death of the daughter of one of Murtaugh’s oldest friends. The General is also in charge of a deadly, militia-like gang of smugglers. Adding fuel to the fire is The General’s chief henchman, played with all stops out by Gary Busey. With the addition of seven minutes extra footage to the original movie, this version of one of the classic ‘buddy’ movies provides new action and additional insight into the characters.

Danny Glover also stars as dependable family-man cop Roger Murtaugh, just turned 50 and facing retirement, just wants to live long enough to see that day. The General is also in charge of a deadly, militia-like gang of smugglers. Adding fuel to the fire is The General’s chief henchman, played with all stops out by Gary Busey. With the addition of seven minutes extra footage to the original movie, this version of one of the classic ‘buddy’ movies provides new action and additional insight into the characters.

results.title: BMX Bandits
results.creator_credit: Brian Trenchard-Smith, Paul F. Davis, Tom Broadbridge and Nilsen Premiere
results.brief_description: Action filled fun entertainment, BMX Bandits stars a very young Nicole Kidman, David Argue and John Ley.

constellations_other.name: Great southern land?
constellations_other.description: Australia is often mythologised in film and TV, but national myths must not only be embraced, but resisted.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Brian Trenchard-Smith, Paul F. Davis, Tom Broadbridge and Nilsen Premiere
results.description: PJ, Goose and Judy are three teenagers saving to buy BMX bikes. In their efforts, they stumble across a case of smuggled walkie-talkies needed by a bunch of crooks for their next job. Accidentally, while testing them, the teenagers alert the police on the same airwave band. The rest of the film becomes a BMX packed chase as the crooks and the police seek the trio. Action filled fun entertainment, “BMX bandits” stars a very young Nicole Kidman, David Argue and John Ley.

Action filled fun entertainment, “BMX bandits” stars a very young Nicole Kidman, David Argue and John Ley.

results.title: Dogs in Space
results.creator_credit: Richard Lowenstein, Glenys Rowe, Burrowes Film Group and Entertainment Media
results.brief_description: Young people enjoy the summer of 1979 in the belief that they will never grow up and join the adult world. Action centres on a Melbourne household of punks, hippies, students and radicals who represent the counter culture and the punk generation.

constellations_other.name: Black Power through film and TV
constellations_other.description: The Black Power movement of the late 1960s and early 70s was “the most exciting and dynamic era in modern Indigenous history” according to Aboriginal activist Professor Gary Foley, who gained widespread attention for protests during the time and later leveraged film and TV to fight for Indigenous rights.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Lowenstein, Glenys Rowe, Burrowes Film Group and Entertainment Media
results.description: A group of young people enjoy the summer of 1979 in the belief that they will never grow up and join the adult world. Action centres on a Melbourne household of punks, hippies, students and radicals who represent the counter culture and the punk generation living on sex, drugs, rock ‘n’ roll and television. Stars Michael Hutchence of INXS.
description_for_label: A group of young people enjoy the summer of 1979 in the belief that they will never grow up and join the adult world. Action centres on a Melbourne household of punks, hippies, students and radicals who represent the counter culture and the punk generation living on sex, drugs, rock ‘n’ roll and television. Stars Michael Hutchence of INXS.

results.title: Monkey Grip
results.creator_credit: Ken Cameron, Patricia Lovell and Pavilion Films
results.brief_description: Explores the joys and traumas of a group of people living in Melbourne’s inner-city. Revolving around the life of a single mother sharing a communal house, the film portrays the lives of talented and reckless artists who refuse to live by the conventional rules.

constellations_other.name: Jan Chapman
constellations_other.description: From an independent Sydney cinema to the world's stage, Jan Chapman's work has many connections to the Australian film scene and Hollywood.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Ken Cameron, Patricia Lovell and Pavilion Films
results.description:
Explores the joys and traumas of a group of people living in Melbourne’s inner-city in the early 1980s. Revolving around the life of a single mother sharing a communal house, the film portrays the lives of talented and reckless musicians, actors and writers who refuse to live by the conventional rules. Noni Hazelhurst received an AFI Best Actress Award for her performance in 1982.

Starring Noni Hazelhurst, Colin Friels, Harold Hopkins, Candy Raymond, Michael Caton, Tim Burns, Cathy Downes, Lisa Peers, Din Miller-Robinson, Alice Garner and Christina Amphlett from the ‘Divinyls’. Adapted from Helen Garner’s novel ‘Monkey Grip’ by Ken Cameron in association with Helen Garner. Cinematography by David Gribble. Editing by David Huggett.
description_for_label:
Explores the joys and traumas of a group of people living in Melbourne’s inner-city in the early 1980s. Revolving around the life of a single mother sharing a communal house, the film portrays the lives of talented and reckless musicians, actors and writers who refuse to live by the conventional rules. Noni Hazelhurst received an AFI Best Actress Award for her performance in 1982.

Starring Noni Hazelhurst, Colin Friels, Harold Hopkins, Candy Raymond, Michael Caton, Tim Burns, Cathy Downes, Lisa Peers, Din Miller-Robinson, Alice Garner and Christina Amphlett from the ‘Divinyls’. Adapted from Helen Garner’s novel ‘Monkey Grip’ by Ken Cameron in association with Helen Garner. Cinematography by David Gribble. Editing by David Huggett.

results.title: Head On
results.creator_credit: Ana Kokkinos, Jane Scott and Head On Productions
results.brief_description: Ana Kokkinos’s debut follows the angry, confused and nihilistic 19-year-old Greek Australian, Ari (Alex Dimitriades) through 24 hours fuelled by drugs, booze and anonymous sex as he grapples with his sexuality and clashes with his traditional Greek family.

constellations_other.name: Ana Kokkinos
constellations_other.description: The films and TV works of Ana Kokkinos often explore the experiences of second-generation Australians, queer identities and class. Since beginning her career in the early 90s, those stories have started to appear more frequently on Australian screens.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Ana Kokkinos, Jane Scott and Head On Productions
results.description:
Based on the novel Loaded by Christos Tsiolkas, Ana Kokkinos’s compelling debut feature Head On is a volatile, confronting and at times bleak look at race, sexuality and class in contemporary Australian society. The film’s lead protagonist Ari (Alex Dimitriades) is an angry, confused, nihilistic, unemployed 19-year-old Greek Australian. The film traces a particularly explosive 24 hours in his life, fuelled by drugs, booze and anonymous sex as he grapples with his sexuality and clashes with his traditional Greek family, who he views with equal amounts of respect and contempt. Performances are excellent throughout, in particular Paul Capsis as Ari’s defiant crossdressing friend Johnny/Toula.

Cast includes Elena Mandalis, Eugenia Fragos, Julian Garner, Dora Kaskanis, Alex Papps, Damien Fotiou. Awards: Best Actor (Alex Dimitriades) and Best Supporting Actor (Paul Capsis) for the 1999 Film Critics Circle of Australia Awards.

Best Feature Film Adaptation (Andrew Bovell, Ana Kokkinos, Mira Robertson) 1998 Awgie Awards.

Best Director (Ana Kokkinos) 1999 San Francisco Lesbian and Gay Film Festival.

Best Achievement in Editing (Jill Bilcock) 1998 AFI Awards.
description_for_label:
Based on the novel Loaded by Christos Tsiolkas, Ana Kokkinos’s compelling debut feature Head On is a volatile, confronting and at times bleak look at race, sexuality and class in contemporary Australian society. The film’s lead protagonist Ari (Alex Dimitriades) is an angry, confused, nihilistic, unemployed 19-year-old Greek Australian. The film traces a particularly explosive 24 hours in his life, fuelled by drugs, booze and anonymous sex as he grapples with his sexuality and clashes with his traditional Greek family, who he views with equal amounts of respect and contempt. Performances are excellent throughout, in particular Paul Capsis as Ari’s defiant crossdressing friend Johnny/Toula.

Cast includes Elena Mandalis, Eugenia Fragos, Julian Garner, Dora Kaskanis, Alex Papps, Damien Fotiou. Awards: Best Actor (Alex Dimitriades) and Best Supporting Actor (Paul Capsis) for the 1999 Film Critics Circle of Australia Awards.

Best Feature Film Adaptation (Andrew Bovell, Ana Kokkinos, Mira Robertson) 1998 Awgie Awards.

Best Director (Ana Kokkinos) 1999 San Francisco Lesbian and Gay Film Festival.

Best Achievement in Editing (Jill Bilcock) 1998 AFI Awards.

results.title: The Homesteader
results.brief_description: Directed by Oscar Micheaux and Jerry Mills.

constellations_other.name: Jedda: Uneven ground, the road to on-screen diversity
constellations_other.description: Jedda was the first fully funded Australian feature to be shot on colour film. It was also the first Australian film with Aboriginal actors in lead roles, however, it reflects a deeply problematic time in Australian history.

results.description: Directed by Oscar Micheaux and Jerry Mills.
description_for_label: Directed by Oscar Micheaux and Jerry Mills.

images.alt_text: An old style fashion poster with three images of people, two men and women, next to the title of the film
